name: STR archer with decent melee skills - SoU / HotU
author: hunearo

posts.author: hunearo
posts.content:
Hi there guys, here's my next insane idea :)

The whole thing started when I played a bit with Hip's Fantabulous Contrapulator and searched for builds with equally good melee and ranged AB. There are many good builds like this, but all of them are DEX based. The best one with STR focus stops at 42/37 melee/ranged (the Dodji Domotai by Valerfor) and that 37 ranged AB is just a sidekick of the high DEX, but the build seems to be melee focused to me. TBH even amongst the DEX builds the only one I found with intended focus in both melee and ranged is the Wulgar Ironbow by HipRedux with 46 AB in both attack types.
EDIT: I just found a very similair build by Mick, the Dual Purpose Warrior, but it stops at lvl 20. I haven't found it earlier, because I didn't make searches for AA builds with STR focus, I only checked the ab. Well, one more reason to make a lvl40 version of it:)

So, how should it look like? I see only two possibilities here:
 - the first one is some kind of druid or druid/shifter where we use high WIS and zen archery for ranged attacks and shapeshifting for melee attacks (like dragon form), but I'm not really interested in this right now
 - the other one utilizes AA levels to supplement ranged ab with an average DEX score, while we pump STR for melee, and this is what I want to do
- (a third one could be an RDD build, but on first look the STR and DEX would end up around 26, I think the ab would not be enough here)

What classes would I choose?
 - AA, this is obvious
 - for AA prereq I would go with bard, mainly because of UMD and tumble as class skills. The wiz and sorc would give me a slightly better spellcasting, but I dont really want to cast spells
 - for third class I choose fighter, because the build is feat starving, and I think I would loose too much ab if I go CoT

Race:
 - my choice is the half-elf to avoid the XP penalty

Weapons of choice:
 - on the ranged side, bows are must (and probably longbow is a better choice)
 - on the melee side, currently I'm hesitating between sword-and-board and a good two-hander... the build has the chance to take devcrit and go with a scimitar, but also it can go for pure damage and take a greatsword/halberd/etc

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content:
Hi hunearo :)

Now, I haven't crunched any numbers yet, but I wondered whether there was another alternative to the first concept you mention (the druid one) - and that's monk. My first thought would be something on the lines of Monk 20/ CoT 14/ Fighter 6, STR/WIS-based, focusing in Unarmed and zen-based Longbow, and because monk AC benefits from WIS you can wear a frock throughout. Perhaps a pre-epic split of Monk 12/ Fighter 6/ CoT 2. If you go human that means you can get 2 sets of WF and WS, 2 Imp Crits, Blind Fight, PB Shot, Rapid Shot, Zen Archery and Called Shot and still have one feat spare (you'll be getting the knockdown twins, Cleave and the evasions for free).

As I say, just a thought. Any merit?

posts.author: hunearo
posts.content:
Interesting idea... let's just do a quick calculation:
 - start with 16/16 str/wis (and maybe 14int / 12 con)
 - with epic general feats you could get +7 str/wis at most
 - with epic cot feats a maximum of +5 wis is reachable
 - and the +10 on lvlups
This is +22, so 27/27 is reachable. 26/26 is the same, and there is room for two EWFs. 24/24 has the same ab if you take epic prowess, and this means three more epic feats (maybe 2 EWS and armor skin).

Now, lets see the AB:
 - BAB would be 27
 - 24 STR/WIS means +7 modifier
 - WF, EWF and EP is +4 together
On lvl40 you would end up with 38/38 melee/ranged ab.

And sadly AFAIK wf in unarmed doesn't qualify for CoT, so you have to take a third focus. (Or did you take this into account? Because with a third focus you still have one feat spare - 4 bonus from fighter, 1 from cot, 1 from human and 7 general feats)

posts.author: hunearo
posts.content:
I played around a bit, and made some early versions of the lvl40 version AA build... 44/44 or even 45/44 is reachable comfortably, so my goal is to reach 45/45 (or better), but I have to make some little compromises here and there.

One thing I see already: there is no room for devcrit, it would take too much feats (altough I see now a pure AA build with at least 50 ab and maxed - 42 - devcrit dc).

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content:
I could pretend and say "yes, the spare feat was meant for a 3rd focus in order to get CoT", but that would be a big smelly lie, I had actually forgotten. However, no harm no foul, eh? Kama might be a good bet, because then you'd have blunt, piercing and slashing potential. The other feat might be useful for Toughness maybe, making up for a low-ish CON.

My thought was also an initial 16/16 STR/WIS split ending at 24/24, with 2 EWFs and EWSs, Epic Prowess and Armor Skin in epic levels (in other words using 6 of the 7 general feats for stat boosts, leaving the CoT bonuses at 4, 6, 8, 10 and 14 and the remaining general feat to take the aforementioned feats). Although (and this has just come to me as I type) theorectically epic CoT bonuses could also be used for Great Wisdom, so there might be a case for that, as it would free up other stat increases for strength - more sums, I'm afraid.

Your saves would all be considerably better, as indeed would your AC, and your fist would be hitting with a d20 worth of damage.

An AB of 38 might be more problematic - I always try to crack 40, but if it's specifically for SoU/HotU you should be alright. I know we shouldn't design for gear, but we'd be daft not to take it into account to some extent.

Worth pursuing?

EDIT: Sorry, hunearo, you ninja'd me!

posts.author: hunearo
posts.content: That 38 ab is on lvl 40. On lvl 28 it would be around 30 or 31. Of course it is naked ab, but is it enough for HotU?

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
I would say, if this is for SoU/HoTU then make the most fun build you can imagine and don't worry about your AB.
To give you some perspective, big Meph himself has 32 AC. Your biggest opponents would be the second guardian of the path (Pit Fiend) in HoTU and the Dragolich.
In SoU i always found that little dog with psionics a bigger challenge than the final boss (kinda...)
With maxed out all your vital stats (quite easy with HoTU gear) and a +10 weapon from Rizolvir your AB will be more than fine anyway.
Consider that you can also gain another +5 AB for free from the best Henchman ever (Dikins-Epic Bard Song) and this becomes even easier.
So always when playing modules like these, focus on "Fun" than power-building. Or even better Power-Build something Fun!

My problem with CoT instead of fighter is that you loose at least 2 pre-epic AB, or 3 if you want a bard dump level between 8-20, and you have to spend at least 3 points on CHA because you have to start with bard. The same goes for RDD, you can't do it with more than 17 pre-epic BAB and you must start with bard. Also the RDD version seems to be very short on feats at first glance if I want an extra focus on a melee weapon. The plus side is that you can use elf withot penalty with two prestige classes, more base skillpoints, and probably even the RDD version could get better saves.
(Btw I made some glass-cannon Bard/RDD/AA builds earlier, but now the fighter version seems better to me if I only focus on a bow and I go for high devcrit DC and high AB.)

EDIT: of course now I'm talking about lvl40 power building, not the SoU/HotU version.

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content: Hunearo, I don't know if this helps, but I just completed HotU at level 28 as a (solo) meleer with a BAB of 22, with 1 level of Bard and 4 of RDD in pre-epic. You should easily reach level 26/27 from a SoU/HotU trip with a companion and a pre-epic BAB of 17 or 18, so don't fret unduly. As Valerfor and Mick said - enjoy!

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content: That's for damage - not AB. Simply put (perhaps overly simply), the dexterity of the archer and their bow help with accuracy, the arrow and strength of its delivery deal the damage. (Yes, yes, there are other factors to take into account, but I did say "simply")

posts.author: hunearo
posts.content:
Well, it is a bit more complex than I tought first... I was talking about this:
"If the arrow hits the target (using a ranged touch attack), it deals magical damage equal to the archer's enchant arrow bonus and deals piercing damage equal to the sum of weapon base damage (d6 for a shortbow or d8 for a longbow), strength modifier, weapon specialization (if applicable), and epic weapon specialization (if applicable). The piercing damage (only) is tripled in the case of a critical hit."

And here comes the tricky part: 
"The piercing damage is intended to penetrate damage reduction according to the arcane archer's enchant arrow bonus, but a bug in the game (not the script) prevents this."
"Enchant arrow does not help on the touch attack roll"
These are applicable for Imbue arrow, Hail of arrows and Arrow of death. Seeker arrow always hits, and does double of that damage.
However I do not know if an enchant on the bow could help penetrate damage reduction (I would say yes, but I'm not sure).
